description: Students study French language and Moroccan culture in the imperial city of Fes.  An immersion
experience that includes home stays with local French-speaking families, the course focuses on
Moroccan culture yesterday and today, emphasizing the multicultural aspects of Morocco and
facilitating student interaction with the local population.  Field trips to various sites in and
around Fes, day-long visits to Mekn√®s and Moulay Idriss, and a longer excursion to Marrakech and
Casablanca. Review of second-year French grammar is integrated into the reading and discussion
of texts pertaining to Morocco's history and culture and their relation to present-day Morocco.
Taught in French. Prerequisite: French 231 or placement in French 232. Offered during interim.
fullname: French Language and Moroccan Culture in Fes
